key_responsibilities: leading the Member’s existing environmental justice and healthcare initiatives
identifying new areas for legislative action
coordinating with other Members and outside stakeholders
requirements: Experience working on issues related to the environment and/or environmental justice and previous experience working in a Congressional office
Resilient in the face of a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, organized, focused on details, and driven to affect change
Proactive in their policy portfolio and comfortable working with diverse sets of constituents, staff, and community and organizational groups

key_responsibilities: Developing communication plans to increase the Caucus’ reach
Managing the Caucus’ website and social media channels
Creating communication resources for Caucus Member offices
Drafting press releases, communicating with the press, and organizing press conferences
Drafting the Caucus’ weekly newsletter
Building and maintaining relationships with Caucus Members’ communications staff
Assisting the Executive Director with coordinating events and briefs, membership outreach, tracking LGBTQ+ legislation, and policy work
requirements: Excellent writers, detail-oriented, organized, self-starters, team players
Able to produce high-quality work in a fast-paced environment under tight deadlines
Experience working with the press and creating social media content, including graphics
2-3 years of communications experience

key_responsibilities: assisting constituents with federal casework
assisting the Casework Supervisor with casework outreach, intake, and processing
attending community events and conducting casework outreach directly with constituents
liaising with federal agencies and help organize outreach events for the Congressman’s office
requirements: Experience working on federal casework
Positive attitude and the ability to work and set priorities in a fast-paced and challenging environment
Strong writing and verbal communications skills
At least one year of experience working for an elected official or community-based organization
Valid California Driver License and automobile
Bilingual skills

key_responsibilities: managing the front office, including answering, appropriately logging, and directing telephone calls
greeting visitors
monitoring office deliveries
distributing hard and electronic mail
other administrative duties
serving as the office tour coordinator
managing constituent requests for Capitol and White House tours, as well as constituent requests for flags flown over the Capitol
requirements: Motivated self-starters, highly organized, detail-oriented, able to multitask
Exceptional interpersonal skills, and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Excellent “people skills”, displaying compassion in all interactions, and a strong commitment to providing outstanding constituent service
Able to think on their feet, be a problem-solver, demonstrate excellent oral and written skills, maintain a positive demeanor, and demonstrate resilience in a busy environment

key_responsibilities: Long-term and short-term legislative planning for the Member and for ensuring progress on the Member's domestic legislative goals within the Legislative Assistant’s portfolio
Staffing the Member for all House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure activities including full committee and subcommittee hearings and markups
Writing and developing a range of high-quality written materials, including policy reports and policy memos
Tracking policy proposals and implementation in assigned issue areas
Representing the Member externally by attending policy briefings and meetings
requirements: Bachelor’s degree
Minimum of 2 years of experience on Capitol Hill in domestic policy and/or other legislative experience
Ability to think creatively, operate entrepreneurially, and build and motivate strong and effective coalitions of partners on and off the Hill

key_responsibilities: None
requirements: Hill experience
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Advanced degree

key_responsibilities: Leading the drafting of press materials
Monitoring media and issues relevant to the Committee
Handling press inquiries and media relationships
Being responsible for day-to-day press operations
Serving as the on-the-record spokesperson
Leading the development of talking points, remarks, statements, press releases, advisories, and caucus messaging guides
Leading the coordination, preparation, and execution of media interviews, speaking engagements, and press conferences
Monitoring and tracking media appearances, managing media relationships, and working with policy subject matter experts to identify opportunities for media engagement
Assisting with rapid response efforts
Assisting Committee Member offices with any press related needs
Hiring, managing, and supervising press interns
Staffing Chairman at press events
requirements: 3+ years’ experience working in communications or related field
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Willing to execute day-to-day tasks and work successfully within a team
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, prioritize tasks, and adapt quickly and easily for rapid response
On-the-record press experience
Demonstrated understanding of or familiarity with veterans’ issues
Capitol Hill experience

key_responsibilities: Handling a broad range of domestic policy issues, including the member’s Science and Technology Committee work
Drafting and monitoring legislation
Preparing materials for committee hearings and markups
Representing the Member in meetings/briefings
Working with constituent organizations
Performing other tasks as assigned
requirements: Hill experience in a legislative role or comparable experience
Strong understanding of the legislative process
Excellent writing and communication skills
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a fast-paced office
Press and communications experience

key_responsibilities: Interacting with constituents via phone, email and in person
Establishing, following through and completing constituent casework
Keeping accurate and complete case notes and alerts at all times
Interacting with assigned federal agencies
Interacting with local, county and state offices to make and accept referrals
Establishing efficient processes to handle common issues and problems
Cross-training and accepting changing areas of focus as needed
Building and maintaining relationships with constituents, community leaders and organizations on behalf of the Member
Monitoring and updating the Member and Senior Staff of important local issues
Drafting memos and staffing the Member at public events and meetings
Managing special projects independently under the supervision of the Outreach Director and/or District Director
requirements: Experience managing casework
Exceptionally well-organized and attentive to detail
Ability to adhere to established casework processes
Ability to work nights and weekends
Strong oral and written communication skills, including public speaking skills
Excellent at time management
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Ability to maintain good working relationships with the Congressman, staff and constituents
Even temperament, ability to deal effectively with a wide range of personalities, and creative problem solving skills
Casework or other high volume, high touch work
Time spent in a customer service role
Prior experience in community organizing
Work with federal, state or local government

key_responsibilities: Handling a portfolio of legislative issues
Tracking legislation and other developments in assigned issue areas
Taking constituent and advocacy group meetings
Building relationships with district and national stakeholders and advocacy organizations
Reviewing legislation and making recommendations for cosponsorships and letters for the Congressman to sign
Building support for the Member’s legislation and developing/implementing ideas for new legislation to advance the Congressman’s strategic priorities, with guidance from the Legislative Director
Exercising discretion and independent judgment in the formulation and recommendation of policy positions for the Member
Reviewing draft press releases and social media in assigned issue areas for technical accuracy
requirements: 1-2 years of experience as a Legislative Assistant in the House or Legislative Correspondent in the Senate
Experience in formulating and advancing legislation
Demonstrated ability to brief a Member of Congress on complex policy issues both orally and in writing
Ability to work quickly under pressure
Good working knowledge of House legislative processes and procedures
Excellent organization and communication skills
Ability to work well with others
Knowledge of or ties to New Jersey

key_responsibilities: Staffing the Member at open press events in the District and DC

Maintaining the Member’s social media accounts
Drafting and posting content for social media
Producing graphics and videos
Editing photos and videos
Maintaining the website
Compiling daily press clips
Assisting with the drafting of press releases and media advisories, e-newsletters, franked mailings, opeds

Able to work long hours in a fast-paced environment
Superior writing and proofreading skills
Ability to work closely and collaborate with Senior Staff both in the District and in DC
Previous experience building audiences online and maintaining social media accounts
Excellent writing skills
Ability to work well on a team
Experience in principal management

Congressional or campaign experience

key_responsibilities: Drafting legislation
Writing hearing statements
Legislative memos

office: Subcommittee on Economic Opportunity, House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs
key_responsibilities: Providing administrative, legislative, and research support to Subcommittee staff
Answering the telephone and responding to caller inquiries
Reviewing incoming mail and preparation of correspondence
Maintaining Subcommittee archive, activities report, and relevant publications
Assisting with Subcommittee hearings and full Committee hearings on matters within Subcommittee jurisdiction
Maintaining the Subcommittee’s outstanding deliverable requests made to the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA)
Determining and tracking the status of pending legislation
Participating in staff-level negotiations
Assisting Subcommittee staff in organization of, and preparation for, hearings
Conducting meetings with VA, veteran service organizations or other scheduled parties
Briefing subcommittee Members’ staff
Drafting remarks for Ranking Member and suggested questions for hearings
Preparing memorandums for the full Committee and Subcommittee Ranking Members on matters under the jurisdiction of the Subcommittee
Research preparation of hearings by reviewing previous hearing transcripts, relevant statutes, and VA policy
Responsible for all other duties assigned by the full Committee
